intro: Pterolepis saturejiformis, commonly known as the creeping pterolepis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
